meanings.definition: A device for converting an optical image into an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The iconoscopes captured the image and turned it into a signal.
meanings.sent2: The technician fixed the iconoscopes in the camera to transmit the image.
meanings.sent3: The iconoscopes seemed to have a magical power, transforming pictures into signals.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like iconoscopes, translating the world into electrical impulses.
meanings.sent5: The iconoscopes hummed softly as they worked their technological magic.

meanings.definition: A type of television camera tube.
meanings.sent1: The old TV used iconoscopes to capture the scenes.
meanings.sent2: The iconoscopes in the studio cameras were upgraded for better quality.
meanings.sent3: The iconoscopes in the TV were always up to some mischief, playing tricks on the characters.
meanings.sent4: His mind was an iconoscope, absorbing every detail like a camera tube.
meanings.sent5: The iconoscopes glowed with a faint light, ready to capture the world in pixels.
